pages.text: In the usual case, you can define the spell's element when crafting it. If the element of the spell is not specified(Origin Element), then the element of the spell will be transformed into an element that matches itself by the spirit product or the caster. $(br2)When casting spells, the mana stored in the spirit product will be used first, and when the mana in the spirit product is insufficient, the caster's own mana will be used. Magick context can also be named through the anvil, and the name of the magick context will be displayed when the spirit product is equipped with the spell.

The mana value of a creature will naturally recover, and the mana value limit can be increased by absorbing the elemental energy dropped by other creatures until the limit reaches 5000. All life has a mana value limit of 5000. $(br2)It is worth noting that players will lose a small amount of mana upon death, so try to avoid death as much as possible. $(br2)The specific value of the mana value can be seen in the lower right corner of the Debug interface when F3 is turned on, and the value above the mana value is the elemental shield value.

Magick context can be 'memorized.' Holding a magick context and hold the R button will 'memorize' it, and hold the R button with empty hands will take out the last magick context. Sneaking with empty hands will take out three at a time. $(br2)A memorized magick context can be directly held with a 'spirit product that can install magick context' to switch the magick context on the spirit product. Holding a spirit product and pressing the R button will show the memorized magick context, and clicking it will switch it.

By default, players can memorize three magick contexts. The number of magick contexts that can be memorized can be expanded to a maximum of six by dropping spirit crystals and diamonds together, to a maximum of nine by dropping spirit crystals and magma cream together, and to a maximum of twelve by dropping spirit crystals and chorus fruit together.
